name: thereminhero
text: Inspired!

name: thereminhero
text: A comment left by thereminhero was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by randombeing, joeyramoney, Darthemed)

name: hexjumper
text: While I love Achewood to death, this is one of the few strips that I would consider buying as a signed strip - just 'cause of the way that the dog tries to be human. Bonus points are scored for the fact that it starts crying once it can't walk, as if facing the horrible truth that it's just not human.

name: hollis
text: I'm not trying to be an ass, but isn't it trying to be a cat?

name: kledermans
text: Yes.  Actually, I like the way cats are human in Achewood, but dogs are generally still dogs.

name: tfaironpirate
text: But can still rock a sweatshirt.

name: unsentletter
text:
> While I love Achewood to death, this is one of the few strips that I would consider buying as a signed strip - just 'cause of the way that the dog tries to be human. Bonus points are scored for the fact that it starts crying once it can't walk, as if facing the horrible truth that it's just not human.

Holy crap; yes.

It's enough to shake a dude.

And immediately after, the strip also reminded me of the Mr. Bungle [/url song "[url=http://www.lyricsdirectory.com/index/M/Mr.%20Bungle/Mr.%20Bungle%20-%20Stubb%20(A%20Dub)%20lyrics.htm] Stubb (A Dub) " =

" Do you really think you're gonna grow into a human being? "

name: unsentletter
text:
Crap, my bad; here's that part with no BBcode stuff:


And immediately after, the strip also reminded me of the Mr. Bungle song "Stubb (A Dub)" =

" Do you really think you're gonna grow into a human being? "

name: libelandslander
text: Damn that song forever. Sad as the dickens.

name: mr_pete
text: Sometimes Onstad does this thing in media res and you gotta just hang on and trust he knows which way it goes. Such as this.

name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Zefiel, MR_Wilson, SenseiHollywood)

name: xaxx
text: It lightens my heart to see that people have restrained themselves from laming Asherdan into oblivion for no reason on this comment.

name: saint
text: i cried a little watching this dog try to be so human

name: soticoto
text: ... so feline, you mean.

name: epicurus
text: I remember after this strip Magreaux Dog had its own, separate Wikipedia page. This was such a wierd arc and yet I could not criticize it because it was also hella funny.

name: whuppins
text: I remember that too. I'm glad I wasn't the only person who tried to look it up on Wikipedia.

name: duperando
text:
I loved this story arc so much that I animated the magreaux dog. It's crappy, but I wanted to stick it up here. Bask in its microsoft paint-esque glory. (that is if I can get the BBcode to work)

[IMGS OFF]

name: bazookaradio
text: I feel like this is possibly the weirdest strip. I remember when I first saw this strip  Ithought it was funny, but at the same time i didn't really get it, it's like it was making reference to a true thing that i didn't know about. Achewood does that a lot and i think it's great.

name: agika
text: A comment left by agika was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by silver_lake, nutmeg, Darthemed)

name: zem
text: Most dogs are not like the ones they used to show on America's Funniest Home Videos . Most dogs cannot walk on two legs very well.

name: hellofyellin
text:
Panel ten to eleven, Magreaux dog's thoughts...

Oh man oh man I about to walk this thing OH GOD NO PEOPLE ARE AROUND

I am sorry that was lame. Thank you for your time and patience.

name: senseihollywood
text: I think the dog failing to walk indicates that dogs are way lower than cats and teddy bears in the Achewood/Underground pantheon...the anthropomorhization just never took...

name: dj
text: Evidently Onstad is a straight-up cat person.

name: djwhiterabbit
text: even though he owns a dog?

name: kledermans
text: Well, how could he own a cat if he saw cats this way?  That would be like owning a midget or something.  Not cool.

name: nicolae
text: Wrong.  Licensed midget ownership is the coolest thing ever.

name: zapatos
text:
Midgetmon!

You make them battle.

name: stubob
text: With a little round bed with their name on it...

name: _cheesekayke
text: He owns a dog, not a cat.

name: trollcollins
text:
The Magreaux Dog is one of my favourite pieces of Achewood folklore. It's like the uncanny, the doppleganger, but filtered through the awesomeness of Achewood.

This strip came along about when I started reading Achewood regularly . . . I have great affection for it.

name: trollcollins
text: It is probably not classy to respond to one's own comment 10 months after the fact, but I was just wondering, how many people who hate on the Magreaux Dog get their giggle on for the Mexican Magic Realism camera? I mean, the concept of a Magreaux God is hell of Magic Realist.

name: trollcollins
text:
Magreaux . . .. dog .

Of all the late-night-induced errors to make . . . what a strange one to chance upon . . . (he says while nervously looking over his shoulder)

name: scion
text: Freudian slip. Nice canonical theory, though...all Lacan's Mirror Achewood.

name: closefriend
text: I tried to write a song about the Magreaux Dog once. I couldn't get the lyrics to come out as non-shit (my fault, not Onstad's), but I liked the chord progression, which is a I-III-VI-I in a melodic minor key. The augmented III chord makes it.

name: 1000hz
text: Beef's dialogue in the last panel is classic.

name: heavymetaljesus
text: Magreaux sobbing is almost as sad as Philippe running home to avoid a any more bad luck related happenings.

name: hendetta
text: That dog is seriously the best bad knock-off of Ray.

name: rotavele
text: I keep laughing more and more as I view panels 6-12 over and over again.

name: unquotable
text: *sob*

name: cailetshadow
text:
One of the most famous death omens of British folklore is a large. spectral demon dog called Black Shuck. A death omen is something that comes to collect souls. It is a British belief that if someone envisions the Black Shuck they may expect death to come within a year. The large, all black, demon dog is about the size of a calf, with large eyes that glow yellow, green or red as if on fire. These spooks are often headless, with large glowing holes for eyes. They mostly haunt graveyards or enter the homes of their victims. When the Black Shuck comes to claim his victims!
his bone-chilling howls can be heard rising above the wind. His feet make no sound, but people can feel his breath on their necks. There are many names for this unwanted visitor, such as, Galleytrot, Old Shuck, Shug Monkey, the Hateful Thing, and Hell beast. Hopefully this superstition does not exist, but if it does, it's characteristics will not go undetected. (Guiley 43)

name: jandruff
text: Thanks for that. I love being freaked out at 3 in the morn.

name: unsentletter
text:
Holy fuck!

Death omens from overseas... awesome .

I feel positive that all those various Black Shuck names have been used up by British metal bands over the years.

name: terribleman
text: Shug Monkey \m/

name: alzuna
text: It's daytime and I am now afraid to go to my car, that dog is going to get me. I think I am paranoid probably?

name: kharitonov
text: Well, considering that they can enter the homes of their victims ... you're not safe anywhere, my friend.

name: alzuna
text: I still have under the covers, it's safe there right........

name: pogo
text: Yes, under the covers is always safe.  Well, as long as you're alone there.

name: riazm
text: always.

name: i_love_kate
text: Someone's got a thing for laming reasonable posts from Alzuna. How... queer.

name: tonyhighwind
text: That's fucking metal.

name: jandruff
text: Something about Ray sniffing that way is so moving... And it's the real kind of crying, like when a wave kind of raises up through your throat into your tear ducts, instead of his usual "ABLOOBLOO AH BLOOOO"

name: dasilodavi
text: I've been trying to look the origin of the word Magreaux, and I'm getting nothing but references to this strip.  How did Onstad come up with it?  Is anyone here good with etymology who can take a crack at this?

name: charchar
text:
I am good with etymology. I am not that good. The closest cognate I could find was French: Maigre-eau ("thinning water.")

I just sort of strung words together until they were pronounced Magreaux and sounded ominous. Magreaux is also a name given to French dudes.

name: ham_shoes
text: How much do you want to be it's pronounced "McGruff"?

name: dasilodavi
text:
Mag..reaux..McGreaux...greaux...gruff...Maggruff.

Well I'll be damned.

name: drago25
text: The Magreaux dog trying to walk almost had me on the floor - oh the hilarity

name: red-barchetta
text: The dog sees an audience, licks the straw and makes his move. Awesome.

name: mangtastic
text: If only there was a roller skate somewhere in this strip.

name: hausea
text:
Man, Onstad is hell of unsettling when he wants to be. This magreaux dog thing already scares the shit out of me.

It tried to walk . Christ.

name: mugi
text: Seriously.  I don't know why everyone else is laughing; that thing is CREEPY.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
"we gonna cheat this"

very good.

name: fancyrat
text: Panel 16: "A BLOO BLAH BLOO"

name: carlyle
text: I just... it... This is the saddest thing.

name: nobodyhome
text: This is the saddest thing.

name: nobodyhome
text: Dammit, scratch that comment, i didn't see carlyle's.

name: hendetta
text: Man that dog is a hell of bastardized Ray.

name: greenkoolayd
text: the magreaux dog is a stupid idea, onstrad.  just so's you know.

name: jacoiii
text:
I'm intrigued by Onstad's creation here.

There have been very few cartoonists (if any) willing to produce an entirely new piece of mythology and build a joke around it within a single strip. It shows skill and a general lack of ego.

Onstad could have easily paraded the Magreaux Dog as an example of creative genius but he instead chooses to make fun of it and potentially soften its impact. This could have been the start of a serious, introspective story-arc about death and coming to terms. Instead it ends with a video colonoscopy and a reference to Lyle's "acting".

The fact that Onstad does this kind of thing REPEATEDLY throughout Achewood is pretty incredible stuff.
